name: Mingshuai Chen
content: Mingshuai Chen | Formal Verification Group Search Mingshuai Chen ZJU100 Young Professor Zhejiang University I am a US-equivalent tenure-track Assistant Professor leading the Formal Verification Group at Zhejiang University. Prior to joining ZJU, I worked as a Postdoctoral Researcher at the Software Modeling and Verification Group headed by Prof. Joost-Pieter Katoen at RWTH Aachen University. In 2019, I received the Ph.D. degree in computer science from the Institute of Software, Chinese Academy of Sciences under the supervision of Prof. Naijun Zhan and co-supervision of Prof. Martin Fränzle. My primary research interest lies in formal verification and synthesis, broadly construed in mathematical logic and theoretical computer science. I develop formal reasoning techniques for programs and hybrid discrete-continuous systems for ensuring the reliability and effectiveness of safety-critical software systems while pushing the limits of automation as far as possible. I appreciate – and have been constantly fascinated by – the elegance of mathematical aspects of computer science as well as its impact on real-world applications. See the research statement for my faculty application at ZJU. I have been awarded the NSFC Excellent Young Scientists Fund Program (Overseas) (one of the most prestigious grants for young researchers across China), the Distinguished Paper Award at ATVA 2018, Best Paper Award at FMAC 2019, and the CAS-President Special Award in 2019 (1st awardee from ISCAS ever since its inception in 1985). My research results have been partially applied in the control-program verification of the Chinese lunar lander Chang’e-3 and CTCS-3 high-speed railway system. Check out my CV for more detailed information. Interests Logical Aspects of Computer Science Formal Verification and Synthesis Programming Theory/Languages Probabilistic/Quantum Systems Cyber-Physical Systems AI for Formal Methods Employment ZJU100 Young Professor, 2023.01 - Present Zhejiang University Postdoctoral Researcher, 2019.09 - 2022.11 RWTH Aachen University Education Ph.D. in Computer Science, 2019 Institute of Software, Chinese Academy of Sciences B.Sc. in Computer Science, 2013 Jilin University Academic Services I serve on the following academic committees. Consider submit your work to one of the venues! Editor & Committee Chair Program Co-Chair of QEST+FORMATS 2026 Workshop Chair of ICFEM 2025 Guest Co-Editor of Special Issue on Formal Methods and Their Applications of Journal of Software Co-Chair of Forum on Formal Methods and Their Applications at ChinaSoft 2024 Co-Chair of Forum on Theory and Engineering of Software under Uncertainty at ChinaSoft 2024 Committee Member Senior Member of the China Computer Federation (CCF) Executive Member of CCF Technical Committee on Formal Methods Member of CCF Technical Committee on Theoretical Computer Science Reviewer Panel of Mathematical Reviews Program/Review Committee Member of CAV 2026, OOPSLA 2026, TACAS 2026/2025, ICFEM 2025, ATVA 2025, TASE 2025, FSEN 2025, SETSS 2025, SETTA 2024, RTCSA 2024/2021, ICWS 2024 (SRG Workshop), SYNASC 2022 (Logic and Programming Track) Repeatability/Artifact Evaluation Committee Member of ADHS 2021, VMCAI 2021 Publications Dissertation Mingshuai Chen (2019).
